thread.title: Report: Saints WR Marques Colston Has Separated Shoulder
thread.title_full: Report: Saints WR Marques Colston Has Separated Shoulder

author: Scott Prather
title: Report: Saints WR Marques Colston Has Separated Shoulder
text:
Report: Saints WR Marques Colston Has Separated Shoulder By Scott Prather October 12, 2015 2:47 PM Share on Twitter (Photo by Greg Shamus/Getty Images) 
New Orleans Saints wide receiver Marques Colston suffered a separated shoulder during Sunday’s loss to the Philadelphia Eagles, according to Ian Rappoport of the NFL Network. twitter/@rapsheet 
Colston underwent an MRI today, according to multiple reports. Results of the MRI are not yet available. He was seen following yesterday’s game with his arm in a sling. 
Colston left the contest early, finishing with 3 catches for 36 yards, and appeared to be favoring his shoulder while still on the field. 
The 10 year veteran has struggled with drops this season and has yet to find the end zone. He currently stands at 18 catches for 200 yards on the year.
